page.title: 05The Hills around Dulverton
page.content: The area has a lot of quiet valleys and slopes which are wooded in places and not in others. The hills in October can be bathed in sunshine and the only loud noise is a stag roaring his challenge. Later in the year the same hills can be covered in snow several feet deep and travel is made very difficult with icy conditions.When heavy rains fall, soil can get washed off fields into the river that grows larger until it floods. The wildlife in our wooded valleys includes red deer, badgers, foxes, rabbits, woodpeckers and there are dippers down by the river.
